job_title: Peer Health Educator in Garden City, NY
pros: I absolutely loved informing undergraduates about health! I loved coordinating and hosting fun events! I loved meeting new people on campus although ironically it was a remote position. It is also an independent yet collaborative career development position. I am grateful that this work study position has potential led to community health presentations and can even lead to becoming a professor!
cons: It would have been even better if the salary was enough to cover living expenses and live more comfortably. I would have loved if it had benefits such as health insurance coverage, vacation, and even retirement. I also felt dismal support from the health education team after graduating and after the team leader was promoted. I felt that certain demographics and aspects of health were perceived as a higher priority than the demographics and elements of health that I provided.

4. Management: Hypocrites! Rules are for one individual and it doesn't apply to others even in the same position.

job_title: Administrator in Garden City, NY
pros: One of the loveliest campuses around. People are mostly wonderful, helpful and supportive, and any bad apples seem to come and go quickly. Many employees stick around for years. The first woman President, inaugurated earlier this year (2016) is proactive, approachable and super smart. Can't beat four weeks of vacation a year, plus 11 paid holidays, and the official hours are decent (8:30-4:30, although many administrators put in extra unpaid evenings and weekends.)
cons: Construction over the past few years has caused some issues with parking, but with the opening of the new Nexus building and underground garage, things should now be better. Compensation could be more competitive, but what you don't bring home in your paycheck is more than made up for by the excellent 403b and medical benefits.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Garden City, NY
pros: Tuition remission for employees, their partners and children; tuition exchange for children of employees (competitive program) to receive tuition to certain other universities; great staff and professional employees; terrific working with students, lots of long-term employees with strong loyalty to the university, opportunities for overtime, PTO is excellent
cons: Your experience may depend on where you are placed (certain areas tend to to be better working environments than others), technology is older than what you might find in a corporate environment, salary is on the low side but benefits more than make up for it, progress tends to be slow, parking is horrendous

review_title: A Good School, But Administration is a Joke
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Garden City, NY
pros: There's some talented faculty. Students are enthusiastic. No one seems stressed out. Health benefits are great--twenty vacation days a year, holiday week off, tuition remission. Beautiful campus. Bunny rabbits.
cons: For a university, it's amazing how unintelligent the administration is. The rule seems to be to hire recent graduates, then promote them to director or assistant director (whatever that is, exactly). It seems like the university is run by pretentious, incompetent people in their twenties and thirties who don't actually know what they're doing. Salaries are abysmal. Extremely hierarchical. No rhyme or reason as to who wins favor and/or gets promoted.

review_title: Low salaries, uneven management, high turnover in some jobs
job_title: in Garden City, NY
pros: Good vacation and health benefits, beautiful campus, access to gym, tuition remission.
cons: Salaries are low and shockingly low in some cases. Grade inflation is rampant, there are low academic standards, and there is pandering to unmotivated students in order to keep enrollment up/ The quality of  faculty and programs is uneven. The number of adjuncts more than doubles that of full-timers. Exploitation of adjuncts is unfortunate, as they have little support from management and low pay. Unbelievable, in some programs, there are no full time faculty at all.

job_title: Grounds Mechanic in Garden City, NY
pros: Great work and life balance.  When you leave work at the end of the day, you dont bring your job home with you.  Work is never a stress factor in your life and these days thats very hard to come by.
cons: Working at the University is great but Im afraid there is not as much growth potential and career growth oppurtunites compared to what might exist in the private sector.

review_title: Too many roaches in the kitchen ruin the soup.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Garden City, NY
pros: Had a great team of smart people that I worked with. Some were crazy inbreds of the university.
cons:
• Everyone higher up in higher education HAS NO IDEA what they are doing. They squander the money these poor children hand over ($40k) to this University. 
• Employee conditions especially at Marketing Creative Services is terrible. Racism runs rampant. People of color are looked over for under qualified folks who are not minority.
• Any complaints made to HR or to managers are passed off as "disgruntled employee." When half the department walks out and NO ONE does a damn thing, it isn't disgruntled employees. No one on the outside is even looking into to it. Everyone is covering for everyone else.

review_title: Nice Place to Work but Poor Salary
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Garden City, NY
pros: Clean campus, very safe, nice people, easygoing atmosphere, picturesque campus, decent amount of vacation - 15 vacation days per year, 3 personal, 6 sick days. Christmas week we got off. Student body was nice and educated - most students are local Long Islanders.
cons: Salaries are low for support staff, faculty have told me their salaries are low as well. There was not much room for advancement in my department. My department hired a lot of part timers to avoid benefit costs. Parking was a nightmare at the main campus.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Garden City, NY
pros: Beautiful campus, some great colleagues, some really good students. The good students are really appreciative of good teaching and guidance. IT is outstanding!
cons: No benefits, little regard from departmental administration. It's not a good idea to inform anyone of anything that needs fixing, except the IT departments. Some students see the school as a tradeoff: tuition for an A.

review_title: No opportunities for growth within a breeding ground of hostility and discrimination.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Garden City, NY
pros: Amidst the onslaught of flaws, there are amazing students, faculty, and staff.
cons: uncompetitive wages, hostile environment, no community, rampant unprofessionalism,

review_title: University Administrators are way too political (cut the nose to spite the face)
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Garden City, NY
pros: Small town feel, so generally everyone knew everyone else. Flexible with time and schedules. The president is a respectable man who seems to have tired very hard tird to make the University current with the changing times. On the surface, it appears to be friendly.
cons:
The politics at Adelphi is so prominent, it's almost laughable. People would cut down and undermine their coworkers, supervisors and etc. to suit their own agendas. Only a handful realize what a mess they're in by having dug their own hole deeper. I wondered at times if I was working for a university or on the set of the political show "Scandal". Some adminstrators refuse to work with others simply because they did not want to (Apparently that's a valid reason at Adelphi if you rank high enough!). 

Faculty hide behind their union and there really isn't much growth as a result. Rampant racisim, ageism, sexism, etc. People are appointed to positions that they never earned and those who have worked hard for years remain at the bottom. Promotions have to do with seniority ONLY sometimes, and not qualifications or skills. Though the salary isn't that high compared to other universities, if you are new to the university, there is a good chance you are getting far less than the person you occupied your position before you. Perhaps, you'll probably be offered far less than they intended for the job to go for, SO MAKE SURE TO RESEARCH YOUR POSITION AND NEGOTIATE! You'll regret it if you don't. It seems salaries are arbitrarily constructed, rather than based on skills, knowledge, equivalent experience, etc.

review_title: High turnover because of low-pay scale as far as programming staff
job_title: Programmer Analyst in Garden City, NY
pros: 4 weeks off plus christmas week - total of 5 weeks to start
cons: no matter how many years of experience you have or how good you are you will never make any more than a junior person at another company.

job_title: Assistant Athletic Trainer in Garden City, NY
pros: Adelphi University is a friendly environment that provides a good work/life balance. The university is located in great area of long island and close to all amenities. The campus hosts a wide variety of events to the faculty and community.
cons: The room for advancement is greatly limited at Adelphi. I feel as though I need to look else where to develop as a professional and reach my potential.
